reviewText: Samantha (Michele Feren) is an out of work actress, making mortgage payments by pretending to be a psychic at a local amusement park. She helps a customer (Sallie Glaner) exercise a spirit that gets attached to her. Strange things happen in her home as she consults her friend Maya (Tracy Wiu) by phone as to what to do about a ghost. This is also the one year anniversary of her husband's death.This is a low budget "B: grade horror film. There are no jerking cameras. Most of the filming is of Samantha in a house with stuff moving, most of which we don't see move, it just appears there. In the end we find a connection. There is no specific closure, but you can surmise. The film ends rather abruptly, but not as bad as what Peter Jackson did to us.It is a good little thriller to watch in the dark with screaming girls.  Don't expect too much.Parental Guide: No f-bombs, sex, or nudity.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: I wasn't sure about this but then I watched it. Creepy good but if your the type that creeps out at night watching a scary flick thriller you might want to watch this before the sun goes down
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: Some minor production flaws (probably just budget constraints), but nice plot, direction and acting. The concept is fun and never tries to go too twisty, just keeps developing the central conceit well.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: I took a chance on this film mainly because the trailer looked professionally done.  It wasn't just the trailer, the whole movie was professional.  The lead actress is good, holds her own in the title role.  Her quirky BFF Maya is quite a character; full of energy and enthusiasm, I liked her.  Their bond seemed genuine, like they could be BFF's in real life.  The story was believable and held my interest until the end - I believe I read this was based on actual events(?).I really really liked this movie.  Granted, it isn't an "action-packed" film and you won't see gore and blood - it's a  supernatural, paranormal flick and I think you should take a chance on it - I was very pleased I rented it.
summary: BRAVO.  THE VISITANT IS WORTH VIEWING!!!
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: I actually fell asleep that's how impressive this one was.  The acting was awful, didn't keep my attention obviously since I feel asleep.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: I wanted a scary movie, and got a scary movie.  Anything with ghosts is definitely entertainment for me.  This movie kept my interest from beginning to end, and even on the edge of my seat in places.  I couldn't ask for more.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: This turned out to be a decent movie. I was prepared for the usual stuff but I was pleasantly surprised.  The main character was hard headed and her friend seemed to be a zealot of some sort because she always referred to ghosts.  Get your favorite snack and drink and enjoy.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: No you won't see demons all over the place but you won't see angels or friendly Casper the ghost either. Samantha recently widowed is an actress who while trying and waiting to get her next part pretends to be a psychic fortune teller. One day a distraught young woman plagued by a fiendish entity comes to Samantha for help to rid herself of it, Not believing in spirits Samantha holds her hands asking it to leave it does but when she goes home slowly the nightmare begins. During the hellish nightmare Samantha discovers her deceased husband Stephen's surprising connection to the distraught women who she helped
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: Not too bad, it was a good movie to watch to pass the time.  Not scary at all, but it wasn't terrible.  Acting wasn't too bad and neither was the plot.
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: This film largely takes place in a house.  An actress who has been a widow for a year, has taken a job as a fortune teller at an amusement park.  She doesn't believe in the supernatural.  A friend who does believe in the supernatural has loaned her some props.The actress has been suffering from anxiety since her husband was killed a year ago in a car accident.  She has been undergoing counseling and trying to wean herself off medications.  Therefore she doesn't trust herself when odd things start happening.  She skypes frequently with her best friend, the one who does believe in the supernatural, who is warning her to get out of the house. Of course, she doesn't listen until it is too late.  The production values are good but since nearly all of the film takes place in the house with one character present and another spoken to on a computer screen, it gets boring and drags at times.  You begin to wonder how dumb the main character is not to believe what her friend tells her after so many supernatural events occur in her house!
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: This is a different twist on the theory that a spirit doesn't necessarily haunt a place but haunts the person.  It starts out with a widowed actress working as a fortune teller.  She really wants to get a normal acting job and calls her agent to relay these sentiments.  But, work is work which equals money for the aspiring actress.  Innocent in the ways of the Spirit world, the actress, a non-believer goes through the motions with the few clients that trickle into her small little store front office.  Till one day...a client comes in with problems a fortune teller isn't really prepared to handle.  The client has something that has become attached to her causing strange occurrences.  The actress sends a message to the attached spirit to move on. The client thanks the actress for her help, which the actress dubiously, accepts. The actress, relieved she "helped" the client, starts to close up shop when she notices strange noises and things moving on their own, along with shadows. When the actress leaves it seems she is not alone but being a non-believer she has no explanation for the events to come.  Although predictable, not a bad movie and worth watching.  Enjoy.
summary: Don't take a job as a fortune teller!
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: I really liked this one.  Not a five, but it was really good.  It kept you glued to your seat.
Title: The Visitant

reviewerName: Teri "I grew up without a television, and boo...
reviewText: I foresee this movie will be a flop, which is really unfortunate, because the premise is strong based on paranormal research and theories. I was eager to grab my spoon and eat this up with relish, but, uh oh, somebody doesn't know how to cook. Yuck!  :(  It went down like made for television fare, but the idea certainly has blockbuster potential. Too bad.Best advice, save your money and wait for a remake, or at least until it comes on cable as a filler in the 2 a.m. slot. It's more entertaining than an infomercial.
summary: I Foresee this will be a flop
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: Ya just gotta Luv a movie that begins with a quote by Tom Petty.  Ok, so here's a quirky little indie film that I wouldn't label so much horror as more suspense thriller with an underlying supernatural theme.Basically a struggling and aspiring actress is working a gig as a fortune teller to pay the rent and ends up encountering the real deal when a distressed customer asks for help in getting rid of a spirit that's supposedly haunting her.  A fraudulent exorcism results in unwanted attention from the spirit-world and an evening of spooky events punctuated by stubborn disregard for her BFF's advice (who is totally into spiritualism) all culminating in an unexpected ending.Overall, "The Visitant" has a pretty made-for-television feel which isn't necessarily a bad thing but the pacing does drag a bit and I suspect this might have been a much more interesting flick with about 20 minutes edited out but it does possess some legitimate creepiness and is definitely something you could watch with the entire family as it's surprisingly PG.  :o)
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: It's just okey !! That's about the best I can say. - - In my humble opinion, the end sucked big time !!!
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: The story was good as well as the acting.  It was very suspenseful and unnerving.  It wasn't a blood and gore movie and was not like many of the ghost stories that are so popular today.  I saw a lot of truth in the film itself.  Communication with an unseen entity is not a good thing, if you should contact one keep in mind that most lie, mimic and are pretty much stuck on the Earth plane for a reason.  If you have further interest in the subject read "The Siren Call of the Hungry Ghosts" (a book available on Amazon) which chronicles one mans journey to uncover the truth which eventually led to his death.
summary: The story was good as well as the acting
Title: The Visitant

reviewText: The acting was good, especially the lead role (Which is so important.) The story line flowed well which is also vital. The theme was believable, which too many directors and writers overlook. The filming for this level of budget was superb. The surprise spooks were well engineered... My only wish was that what spooked was more terrifying looking. Smoky monsters, no matter what they're throwing around or tossing around or breaking, etc... just doesn't cut it for me. But, overall, this film gets a Bravo from me. It's hard to tell a story and get everything right about the genre it's cast in correct and this film had a very decent flow and some cool moments.I'm and arm chair critic, so please take into consideration that though I've worked on film for over 25 years in the sound department and am an avid fan of horror flicks, I am still an amateur critic, that is to say, since I've never made a film from top to bottom, I only have some qualifications to critique, not all of them.Thank you for reading my review,Wolfy :)
Title: The Visitant
